meanings.definition: A person who bulges or swells.
meanings.sent1: The bulgers in the painting looked like they were about to burst.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised the bulgers to watch their sodium intake.
meanings.sent3: The bulgers at the buffet table were causing a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned into bulgers when she smiled widely.
meanings.sent5: The bulgers on the balloon made it float effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A plural form of bulger, meaning a person who bulges or swells.
meanings.sent1: The bulgers in the room all wore loose clothing.
meanings.sent2: The bulgers gathered at the gym to work on their fitness.
meanings.sent3: The bulgers at the party were easy to spot in their tight outfits.
meanings.sent4: The bulgers in the crowd made it hard to see the stage.
meanings.sent5: The bulgers on the tree branch made it bend under their weight.

meanings.definition: The act of bulging or swelling.
meanings.sent1: The sudden bulgers in the fabric indicated a tear.
meanings.sent2: The bulgers in the river caused it to overflow its banks.
meanings.sent3: The bulgers in the balloon made it ascend rapidly.
meanings.sent4: The bulgers in the cloud signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The bulgers in the balloon made it rise gracefully into the sky.
